page.title: 06SAND QUARRYING:JOSEPH ARNOLD
page.content:
The{Sand Industry}dominates the area. The history of one company is typical.
Formed in 1860 by John Arnold we know very little about the early days except that the sand was{excavated}by pick and shovel. The 1914/18 war saw the rise of local sand's importance.
Transport costs, particularly due to costs of repairing local roads, led to the construction of a 2 foot gauge {light railway}to connect with the {London Midland & Scottish}railway.
By 1930 the company owned many quarries in the area. It is still active today.
The sand is so pure that it is the basis of{International Standards.
